intro: Lagurus dalmaticus, commonly known as the Dalmatian hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant features feathery, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of dandelions, and it grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often found in regions with mild, temperate climates.
